page.title: 01THE BERKELEY AREA
page.content: The Berkeley area lies in the Severn Vale between the escarpment of the western Cotswold Hills and the River Severn. The land is flat, river valley land mostly used for dairy farming. None of the land is more than 30 metres above sea level. The main A38 Gloucester to Bristol road runs through the eastern part of our block, as does the main Gloucester-Bristol railway. There is a branch line which runs across the north of our block towards Sharpness Docks on the Severn, but that is for goods trains only. Most of the people live in the small town of Berkeley but there are small villages at Ham and Berkeley Heath. Two features which lie outside our block but which have an important influence on it are the M5 motorway to the east and Berkeley Nuclear Power Station to the west.
